Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2014 08:31AM - edited Jun 13, 2014 08:34AM by someone_in_nj DeAnaR, I hope you kept your appt.  I had similar issue.  I could feel the smooth lump but it won't show on ultra sound or mammogram.  Dr. did a fine needle aspiration procedure, which basically means they insert a needle in the area and remove sample, then check it under microscope.  It takes less than 4 minutes to get instant result.  Mine was fatty tissue.  It's better to check out then remain consciously concerned.
Posts.Title: Lump not showing up on mammogram or ultrasound DeAnaR Nemmett44
